New Records: DL Hall worked seven scoreless innings in the best start of his career
Willy Adames hit a three-run homer, his 26th, and Rhys Hoskins hit a two-run shot in the seventh, his 22nd
Key Match Events: The Brewers scored 10 runs in the ninth inning to pound the Cincinnati Reds 14-0
The game got out of hand in the ninth inning
Eric Haase scored on a double play in the 10th inning and Devin Williams made it stand up
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers manager Pat Murphy emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
DL Hall was optioned to Triple-A Nashville after his previous start on Aug. 11 and recalled Friday
Post-Match Reflections: Reds manager David Bell said 'There is really no choice. We'll get over it.'
Brewers manager Pat Murphy said 'I respect the heck out of the Reds. I donâ€™t care what their record is. It is a war.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers stole four bases, two by Brice Turang
Right-hander Rhett Lowder made his major league debut for the Reds
The Reds fell to 3-4 in extra innings
